title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus X factors for final stretch
content: See our latest rankings ahead of Week 14. We also picked out X factors for the last five weeks of the regular season.

title: Giants bench Carter again at start of MNF loss
content: Giants first-round pick Abdul Carter didn't start or play early in Monday night's matchup with the Patriots because of a coach's decision.

title: Patriots, led by 'conductor' Maye, first to 11 wins
content: QB Drake Maye turned in a masterful performance in a 33-15 beatdown of the visiting Giants on Monday night as the Patriots improved to an NFL-best 11-2 heading into their bye week.

title: 'Not playing soccer': Dart OK after Elliss' big hit
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart took a bone-crushing hit near the sideline in the first quarter of Monday night's 33-15 loss to the Patriots, but he remained in the game and told reporters afterward that "this is football."

title: Sources: BYU's Sitake focus of Penn State search
content: The Penn State coaching search, which has gone quiet in the past few weeks, has focused on BYU coach Kalani Sitake, sources told ESPN on Monday, confirming a report by On3.

title: Sources: Mets give Devin Williams $51M contract
content: The New York Mets and reliever Devin Williams agreed to a three-year, $51 million deal, league sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan Monday night, giving the club a replacement for Edwin Diaz should the All-Star closer sign elsewhere.

title: Kiffin ready to make LSU nation's 'best program'
content: A day after flying out of Oxford, Mississippi, Lane Kiffin was introduced as LSU coach Monday, promising to restore the Tigers to being "the best program in all of college football," while detailing his excruciating decision to leave Ole Miss.

title: Brooks resumes LeBron trash talk in 33-point show
content: Dillon Brooks lit up the Lakers for 33 points in the Suns' 125-108 win Monday night, agitating both the Los Angeles crowd and LeBron James, whom he sparred with during the 2023 playoffs.

title: Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: Wetzel: Kiffin left an actual playoff team for a theoretical one. He should be honest about why
content: Lane Kiffin might be a great coach, but he wasn't mistreated by Ole Miss or "the calendar" or anything else.

title: Ranking the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates -- and finding their best fits
content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

title: From bed rest to champion: Inside Chet Holmgren's comeback
content: Holmgren was sidelined for three months last season because of a fractured pelvis and is "chasing for more" this season.

title: Bracketology: Texas moves up to No. 2 overall, but UCLA is the 1-seed to watch
content: The Bruins suffered their first loss and got leapfrogged by Texas. But UCLA has Quad 1 wins and more depth on the way.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (19!), Broncos' D (51!)
content: The Browns vet and Denver are on pace to rewrite the single-season sacks record book. Here's how they got here.

title: Will Brandon Aiyuk return for the 49ers this season? Answering five top questions
content: San Francisco voided the receiver's contract guarantees for next year. What does that mean for this season and beyond?

title: George Pickens, C.J. Stroud and a career day for a Jets WR highlight Next Gen Week 13
content: Pickens was a monster on slant routes while Stroud made the Colts pay for blitzing. Here are the highlights.

title: How to bet the Heisman Trophy race, which comes down to the Big Ten championship game
content: With the race expected to come down to Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza and Ohio State QB Julian Sayin, the Big Ten championship game likely determines who wins the Heisman Trophy.

title: Why Christian Pulisic might be in the midst of his best season as a pro -- and why it might not last
content: The U.S. men's national team star is having a career season in Italy with AC Milan. What has changed for Christian Pulisic?

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Wolverines on the rise
content: The fourth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: UConn still the team to beat
content: The fourth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Sri Lanka aid: India rejects Pak's 'ridiculous' flight claim; netizens mock 'expired' relief
content: Pakistan accused India of delaying its humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka, claiming airspace permission was withheld. India refuted these allegations, stating the request was processed within four hours. Meanwhile, Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka faced online criticism over relief packages with apparent near-expiry dates.

title: 'Imran Khan alive but...': Sister Uzma meets jailed leader; big charge against Munir
content: Imran Khan's sister, Uzma Khanum, confirmed the former Pakistan PM is "completely fine" after a rare jail visit. Weeks of restricted access had sparked protests and death rumours. Despite court orders, family and party leaders faced repeated denials, leading to legal challenges and allegations of police brutality against protesting sisters. PTI seeks regular, unhindered access.

title: Watch: DRDO tests fighter jet ejection system; Rajnath Singh hails milestone
content: India has achieved a significant milestone in indigenous defence capabilities with a successful high-speed rocket-sled test of a fighter aircraft escape system. This dynamic trial, conducted by DRDO, validated canopy severance, ejection sequencing, and aircrew recovery, placing India among nations with advanced in-house testing. The test simulated real-life conditions, marking a step towards self-reliance in defence.

title: Trump sanctions: Crude imports from Russia at a high - can it continue?
content: India's Russian crude imports are set to dip following US sanctions on major oil firms, but a permanent shift is unlikely. Refiners are strategically sourcing from non-sanctioned Russian entities and other global suppliers. Despite temporary disruptions, India's demand for cost-effective Russian oil, coupled with emerging workarounds, suggests continued, albeit indirect, procurement.

title: What's brewing? Kohli ignores Gambhir, Rohit stops for a quick chat ahead of 2nd ODI
content: Virat Kohli looked sharp and assertive, taking on throw-down experts Raghu (right-arm) and Nuwan Seneviratne (left-arm), who pushed the pace throughout the session. The battle was compelling to watch — Kohli found the middle of the bat repeatedly, though there were moments when Raghu’s extra pace beat him. Head coach Gautam Gambhir stood positioned between the two nets, observing the session closely.

title: 'AI will destroy Zoho' - American investor Garry Tan; Vembu challenges him to bet
content: Zoho's chief, Sridhar Vembu, has passionately responded to the forecasts made by Y Combinator's Garry Tan, which suggest that AI's 'vibe coding' could extinguish the flame of Indian SaaS innovators. Vembu emphasized the strong trajectory of Zoho's customer base, casting doubt on the effectiveness of AI-generated applications for the nuanced requirements of businesses and raising alarms about potential technological debt.

title: Military pact: Russia opens ports, airspace to Indian warships & planes; what it means
content: Russia's State Duma has ratified a major military logistics pact with India, the Reciprocal Exchange of Logistic Support (RELOS). This agreement allows both nations' military forces to utilize each other's facilities for joint exercises, humanitarian operations, and disaster relief, strengthening their strategic partnership ahead of President Putin's visit.

title: 'Space teaches you to adapt': Grp Cpt Shukla on what ISS got right, what India can learn
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla reflects on his ISS mission, highlighting its success as a model of international cooperation and scientific advancement. His insights offer valuable lessons for India's own long-term human spaceflight strategy, emphasizing modularity, flexibility, and clear objectives for the upcoming Bharatiya Antariksh Station.

title: Does Harshit Rana get preferential treatment from Gambhir? Pacer breaks silence
content: Fast bowler Harshit Rana dismissed claims of preferential treatment under head coach Gautam Gambhir, stating he focuses solely on his on-field performance. Rana, who debuted across formats during Gambhir's tenure, emphasized his commitment to hard work and avoiding external noise. He is actively working with bowling coach Morne Morkel and Arshdeep Singh to enhance his new-ball skills.

title: Workplace success: Satya Nadella says 'can't rely on brains alone'; reveals 'best tool'
content: In a world increasingly dominated by artificial intelligence, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella argues that emotional intelligence is essential for business leaders. He posits that while AI can manage technical tasks, the human touch—through empathy and collaboration—remains irreplaceable in driving success.

title: Rupee tumbles to hit life-time low! Currency nears the 90 per dollar mark
content: The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of 89.95 against the US dollar, driven by speculators and importers. Experts cite a strong dollar and delayed trade deal as key factors. While some foresee appreciation with a trade deal, others expect continued volatility around the 90-per-dollar mark.

title: Ro-Ko mania hits Raipur! Virat Kohli goes big, Rohit Sharma takes notes - WATCH
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma showcased impressive form in training ahead of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur. Following a thrilling 17-run victory in Ranchi, where the duo starred with a century and a sixes record respectively, India aims to extend their series lead.

title: 'Chor ki daadhi mein tinka': BJP defends Sanchar Saathi app; jabs Cong over privacy row
content: Bharatiya Janata Party has responded to Congress accusations regarding the Sanchar Saathi app. BJP leaders stated the app aims to protect users from fraud and crime, not to monitor them. They emphasised that the application can be removed by users. Congress had alleged the directive was dictatorial and called the app a snooping tool.

title: Bankruptcy alert: Bernie Sanders warns Americans; over 5 lakh may be at risk
content: US Senator Bernie Sanders has sounded the alarm on America's medical debt crisis, revealing over 530,000 people face bankruptcy annually due to healthcare costs. He contrasts this with countries like Germany and Canada, which report zero medical bankruptcies. Sanders argues this financial ruin from illness is a moral and economic failure, advocating for Medicare for All.

title: Matthews’ captaincy questioned as ex-GM hints Leafs picked the wrong leader
content: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: SoftBank founder says he was ‘crying’ while offloading Nvidia stake — here’s why
content: SoftBank's Masayoshi Son revealed he 'was crying' while selling Nvidia shares, a painful but necessary move to fund AI ventures like OpenAI. Despite the emotional toll, Son emphasized the critical need for capital for future AI investments, dismissing concerns about an AI bubble and predicting its immense long-term economic impact.

title: Sensex vs Gold: What should you opt for in 2026? Here’s the outlook
content: Indian stock markets are poised for a constructive 2026, driven by an improving earnings cycle, strong domestic liquidity, and normalizing valuations, says Ajay Menon, MD & CEO – Wealth Management, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Which sectors should investors focus on? Will other emerging markets and even gold continue to outperform Indian equity benchmarks in 2026 as well?

title: Cyberfraud: Banks could be liable; authorities push lok adalat route for quick relief
content: Banks may face liability for cyber fraud losses if "due diligence" is found lacking, Haryana DGP OP Singh stated. Investigations will determine bank accountability for customer compensation.  The DGP also highlighted measures for faster release of frozen funds and an expanded awareness campaign involving students as cyber ambassadors.

title: What's cooking? Kohli seen having serious conversation with India selector ahead of 2nd ODI - watch
content: Team India has arrived in Raipur for the second ODI against South Africa, holding a 1-0 series lead. A video of Virat Kohli and selector Pragyan Ojha in an intense airport conversation has sparked fan speculation. Kohli's match-winning 135 in the first ODI was crucial to India's victory.

title: 'Dhurandhar': Film's final length 214 mins after CBFC trims violence and mutes bad words
content: Ranveer Singh’s action film 'Dhurandhar' releases on December 5, 2025. With a runtime of 214 minutes, it’s Bollywood’s longest film in two decades. The film received an 'A' certificate, includes toned-down violence and added disclaimers. Cast includes Sanjay Dutt, Sara Arjun, and directed by Aditya Dhar.

title: Madison Beer turns Chargers’ win into birthday celebration as Herbert battles injury
content: Madison Beer celebrated her mother's birthday at a Chargers game, transforming a suite into a festive event. Meanwhile, quarterback Justin Herbert showcased remarkable grit, playing through a broken hand to lead the Chargers to victory. His performance and Beer's family presence fuel speculation about their strengthening relationship as the Chargers push for the playoffs.

title: 'Kill them all': Pete Hegseth's order is a feature of America's cowboy justice
content: Which brings us to Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth and the now-infamous “Kill Them All” directive. The mainstream American commentariat is working overtime to portray his alleged order — to eliminate the two survivors clinging to the wreckage of a bombed Caribbean vessel — as a shocking departure from established norms. But the truth is far less flattering. The Caribbean strike is not a fracture in American conduct. It is the logical expression of it. It is not an aberration. It is a revelation.

title: Diabetes Tips: Expert shares 60-second trick to quickly lower blood sugar levels
content: A quick one-minute stair climb after eating can effectively lower blood sugar spikes. Research shows even brief periods of climbing stairs significantly reduce glucose levels. This simple exercise engages leg muscles to absorb sugar without relying on insulin. Physiologist Jose Tejero recommends this habit for metabolic health. It offers benefits beyond blood sugar control, aiding blood pressure and energy levels.

title: Trade reset: China issues rare earth licences; questions persist over wider access
content: China has issued new general export licenses for rare earth shipments, easing months of disruption caused by tighter controls. This move, following the Trump-Xi summit, allows year-long permits for specific customers, particularly in the auto sector. While easing some pressures, differences remain between Beijing and Washington regarding the extent of these changes.

title: Suryavanshi hits 3rd T20 ton, but fastest-to-three record belongs to someone else
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the youngest centurion in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy history, scoring an unbeaten 108 for Bihar. His remarkable innings, however, wasn't enough as Maharashtra, led by Prithvi Shaw's 66, chased down Bihar's total to secure a victory. The result gave Maharashtra their second win from four matches in the group.

title: 'What did poor dog do?' Rahul mocks row over pup in Parliament; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi commented on Renuka Chowdhury bringing a stray dog to Parliament, stating pets are not allowed outside but "inside." Gandhi's remarks drew criticism from the BJP, who accused him of comparing opposition leaders to dogs. Chowdhury had brought the puppy after finding it near Parliament.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Deep depression U-turns towards East Coast; red alert issued for Chennai
content: A deep depression, a remnant of Cyclone Ditwah, has turned back towards the east coast, prompting a red alert for Chennai and neighboring districts.  Extremely heavy rainfall is expected in northern Tamil Nadu. The system is currently very close to the coast and is forecast to weaken before making landfall south of Chennai.

title: Delhi derailed: Tripura defeats star-studded side in Syed Mushtaq; script history
content: Delhi's domestic cricket woes deepened with a historic 12-run loss to Tripura in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. Chasing 158, Delhi's batting faltered on a slow pitch, finishing at 145 for 8. Indrajit Debnath's crucial last-over bowling secured Tripura's maiden win against Delhi, raising questions about team selection.

title: Why Jaxson Dart wears eye black and a chain: The touching reason behind his ritual
content: New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart's sparkling necklace is more than just an accessory; it's a cherished gift from his sister. This meaningful charm, worn for every game, symbolizes family, faith, and a reminder to spread love and joy. Dart views it as a powerful connection to home, grounding him amidst the NFL's spotlight.

title: SIR burden turns fatal: UP headmaster's heart attack raises alarm; 8 deaths in 10 days
content: Eight election workers have died in Uttar Pradesh during intensive revision duties in just ten days, including three suicides. A headmaster in Sambhal succumbed to a heart attack, with his family citing immense work pressure. Officials are facing scrutiny as teachers, often deployed due to manpower shortages, bear the brunt of demanding electoral tasks.

title: Bitcoin meltdown: Strategy stock tanks over 60%; retail ETF wipe-outs spark fresh fears
content: Investors who followed Michael Saylor's Bitcoin strategy are now facing heavy losses. Strategy Inc.'s stock has seen a sharp decline, causing leveraged funds tied to it to unwind. This has erased previous gains and is impacting asset retention for funds tracking the company's volatile Bitcoin bets.

title: When pollution crosses the line: AQI 500 vs AQI 200 — what these numbers mean for your lungs
content: India's Air Quality Index (AQI) translates pollution levels into health risks, classifying air quality into six categories. PM2.5, a key pollutant, deeply impacts lungs and bloodstream, with levels of 200 causing noticeable stress and 500 leading to severe complications. Vulnerable groups like children and the elderly face heightened risks.

title: Ciara brings ‘sassy and saucy’ vibes to NYC photoshoot for Remix Magazine
content: Ciara graces the cover of Remix Magazine, discussing her new album "CiCi" and two decades in music. The interview highlights her creative independence and first project on her own label. The accompanying photoshoot showcases her commanding presence in a series of powerful business and fashion-forward looks against the New York City skyline.

title: 'Not for me to clarify': Bavuma plays down 'Grovel' remark; calls for more Tests against India
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma downplayed his coach's "grovel" comment, stating it wasn't a distraction for the team. Bavuma acknowledged the strength Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma bring to India's ODI side, noting their familiarity but also their significant experience. He also highlighted Marco Jansen's valuable all-round contributions and expressed a desire for more Test matches against top nations.

title: IPO boom continues! December set to be another big month - what's on the list?
content: India's primary market is set for a massive year-end, with December poised to raise nearly Rs 30,000 crore from around 25 IPOs. Major listings like ICICI Prudential AMC and Meesho are leading the charge. This surge, fueled by strong business confidence and discerning investors, signals robust market momentum extending into 2026.

title: IND vs SA: 'I was in school when Rohit Sharma played the 2007 T20 World Cup', says Temba Bavuma
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma acknowledges Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's significant impact on India's lineup, despite facing them before. He highlighted their crucial roles in the first ODI and expressed a desire for more high-quality bilateral series against top nations, humorously noting players' aging concerns.

title: 'Forced Pak ships to stay in ports': Navy chief on Op Sindoor; fleet on full alert
content: India's third indigenous nuclear-powered submarine is set for commissioning soon, announced Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi. He also detailed how Operation Sindoor's aggressive naval action forced Pakistan's forces to remain near their coast. The Navy's extensive operations over the past year, including continuous anti-piracy duties and significant ship and flying hours, were also highlighted.

title: Sanchar Saathi App row: Can you delete it? Centre's big clarification after opposition's 'snooping' charge
content: Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that the Sanchar Saathi app is optional and can be deleted by users, refuting claims of mandatory pre-installation and disabling. The app aims to prevent cyber threats and track lost or stolen phones, not for snooping. This clarification follows a Reuters report about a government order for major smartphone companies.

title: 'One speech could set fire': Punjab opposes Amritpal's temporary release; hearing on Dec 8
content: Punjab government strongly opposed Amritpal Singh's temporary release to attend Parliament, fearing his speeches could destabilize the state.  The High Court has ordered the government to present specific evidence justifying the denial of his request. Amritpal is currently jailed under the NSA in Assam.

title: These guys deserve better! Ex-selectors say Rohit & Virat must stop being put on trial
content: Former selectors and experts urge Indian cricket to end the constant scrutiny of Rohit and Virat, highlighting their continued capability. Despite recent performances, the team management's approach to the 2027 World Cup preparation, particularly regarding the captaincy transition, has caused unease. Clear communication and a defined plan are crucial for the veterans and the team's future.

title: BB19: Amid speculation of a fallout, Rupali Ganguly extends her support to Gaurav Khanna
content: Rupali Ganguly, Gaurav Khanna's former co-star from 'Anupamaa', has publicly backed him for the Bigg Boss 19 finale. While praising other contestants, Ganguly declared Khanna deserves to win the trophy. This support comes amidst past rumors of a rift between the two actors.

title: "Source Of Strength": Khaleda Zia's Son After PM Modi's Post Extending Support
content: BNP chief Tarique Rahman saidthe offers of support from leaders across the world have been a "source of immense strength".

title: 4 Dead In Rain-Related Incidents As Cyclone Ditwah Skirts Tamil Nadu Coast
content: Four people have died in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu as Cyclone Ditwah remained close to state's coast, bring heavy rains.

title: In 2 Breakfasts With DK Shivakumar, Siddaramaiah Says There Was 1 Difference
content: The meetings were about trying to resolve a power tussle for Karnataka's chief minister post, but the two breakfasts between Siddaramaiah and his deputy, DK Shivakumar, in the space of four days have also attracted attention for their menus.

title: Notice Issued To Kerala Chief Minister 'Fraud': Congress On Masala Bond Case
content: The Congress in Kerala on Tuesday said it does not trust the show-cause notice issued by the Enforcement Directorate to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan in the KIIFB Masala Bond case, calling the central agency's move "fraudulent".

title: Despite Trump Tariffs, "Resilient" Global Economy To Grow 3.2% This Year
content: The world economy has proven surprisingly durable in the face of President Donald Trump's trade wars, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said Tuesday, upgrading its outlook for global and US economic growth this year.

title: Prashant Bhushan Calls Poll Body "Despot". Supreme Court Objects
content: Senior advocate Prashant Bhushan, while making submissions on legality of the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists or SIR in the Supreme Court today, used a derogatory term for the Election Commission.

title: 'Dec 21, Not Dec 3': High Court On Maharashtra Local Body Poll Results
content: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court on Tuesday directed the Maharashtra State Election Commission (SEC) to hold the counting of votes for all the local body polls on December 21, instead of December 3.

title: Rahul Gandhi Adds Fuel To Dog Row, Says Pets Allowed Inside Parliament
content: Adding fuel to the controversy sparked by his party colleague Renuka Chowdhury, who said "those who bite are inside Parliament" after she reached the complex with a dog, Rahul Gandhi has quipped that pets are allowed inside the legislature.

title: New Complex Housing PM's Office Renamed As 'Seva Teerth': Sources
content: The Prime Minister's Office or the PMO will be renamed Seva Teerth, in line with citizen-first governance, sources have told NDTV.

title: "Roads Can't Hold Crowd He Draws": No Nod for Vijay's Puducherry Roadshow
content: Puducherry Police have refused permission for actor Vijay's proposed December 5 roadshow and have instead advised him to hold a public meeting in an open ground, prompting uncertainty within his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK).

title: Air India Under Probe For Operating Aircraft With Expired Safety Certificate
content: Air India is under regulatory scrutiny by the aviation watchdog after one of its 164-seater A320 aircraft, operated eight times on November 24 and 25, despite an expired airworthiness review certificate.

title: "We Understand There Is Pressure Over India": Russia On US Tariffs
content: Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Tuesday addressed concerns over India facing high US tariffs for purchasing Russian oil, saying Moscow recognises the challenge but will not intervene in New Delhi's bilateral issues with Washington.

title: "DK Shivakumar To Be Chief Minister If...": Siddaramaiah Leaves Decision To Congress
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah met his deputy, DK Shivakumar, for a 'power breakfast' Tuesday morning, a meeting between the state's two most important leaders that under any other circumstances might have seem normal.

title: Kerala Request To Extend SIR Form Deadline "Just And Fair": Supreme Court
content: Terming a petition by the Kerala government to extend the date for submission of forms for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) "just and fair", the Supreme Court on Tuesday advised the Election Commission to consider the proposal.

title: "Do We Give A Red Carpet Welcome?" Chief Justice In Rohingya Missing Case
content: Coming down heavily on a petition that sought the tracking of five missing Rohingya, Chief Justice of India Surya Kant has asked if the country should roll out a red carpet for illegal immigrants

title: Exclusive: Pakistan Constructs New Buildings, Removes Destroyed Hangar At Bases Struck By Air Force
content: New high-resolution satellite imagery with NDTV indicates that Pakistan has cleared out debris of a hangar at its airbase in Sukkur, struck by the Indian Air Force during Operation Sindoor on May 10 this year.

title: Muslim Cleric's Call On Microphone Saves 7 People In Sinking Vehicle
content: The vehicle had lost control, skidded off the National Highway and plunged into a pond in Assam's Sribhumi district.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look ahead to Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: Buzz: Justin Herbert set for surgery, but aims to play in Week 14
content: Herbert set for surgery, Meyers keeps producing for the Jaguars and Irving looked good in his return in Week 14

title: Allende outshines Messi as Miami book spot vs. Vancouver
content: Tadeo Allende's performance of a lifetime, and the own goal that broke San Diego hearts. Cesar Hernandez and Joseph Lowery to sum up the best and worst of MLS' conference finals as Inter Miami book a date with Vancouver.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United lead race for Gallagher
content: Manchester United, Newcastle, Everton and Tottenham Hotspur are all interested in signing Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Can ‘suspicion’ of impurity lead to an exercise which threatens statelessness, petitioners ask SC in SIR hearing
content: Supreme Court hears arguments that the Special Intensive Revision allows mass scrutiny of citizenship based on mere suspicion, posing threats of disenfranchisement and statelessness

title: YouTubers cannot harm business in the guise of reviewing products: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar directs YouTube LLC to block a video review of a water energiser on one of its channels

title: Cyclone Ditwah’s unusual stall leads to prolonged rains in Tamil Nadu
content: While the system was expected to move away from T.N. coast by Monday, it remained stationary for several hours and drew in more moisture, generating fresh bands of rain-bearing clouds

title: ‘Rythanna Meekosam’ workshops in Andhra Pradesh on December 3
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to participate in the session to be organised at the Nallajerla Rythu Seva Kendra in East Godavari district

title: Russia focused on increasing trade with India despite ‘obstacles’ by third countries: Dmitry Peskov
content: Kremlin spokesperson said the share of U.S. dollars in global trade is ‘decreasing’ and that of national currencies in global trade is ‘increasing’; he says upcoming visit of Russian President Vladmir Putin to India will include a proposal on setting up small modular reactors

title: Telangana launches six-week ‘Fraud Ka Full Stop’ campaign
content: SPARC Cyber Clubs (Student Program for Awareness and Responsible Cyberspace) in schools and colleges and SBI Cyber Defenders aimed at improving preventive vigilance among bank staff and vulnerable customers were also introduced at launch

title: Governor orders V-Cs to enforce hostel discipline, decides to form panel to curb campus violence
content: Mohanan Kunnummal to head panel to recommend suggestions to contain violence on university and academic campuses

title: IT Minister reviews preparations for TG Rising Global Summit
content: Urges officials to ensure the event is organised in a manner that captures global attention and strengthens Telangana’s international brand image

title: Agniveer Combat Spectacle brings patriotic fervour to Artillery Centre Hyderabad
content: In one of the most animated segments of the evening, the Agniveers performed a sequence of floor exercises and stunts in their physical training uniforms

title: Govt. authorises CRDA to launch LPS 2.0 in seven villages in Amaravati capital region
content: It is to facilitate urban infrastructure and planned development in the capital region, strengthening the State’s ongoing efforts to accelerate Amaravati’s growth trajectory

title: BRS to step up struggle against HILTP with visits to clusters planned for land use change
content: Working president of the party KTR says 8 fact-finding teams of the party to visit industrial clusters notified under the policy on Dec. 3, 4

title: Bangalore Apartments’ Federation urges for tabling KAOMA in the upcoming Belagavi session of legislature
content: The Bangalore Apartments’ Federation (BAF), representing over 1,400 apartment and villa resident welfare associations (RWAs), has urged the State government to table and implement the Karnataka Apartment Ownership and Management Act (KAOMA) during the Winter Session of the legislature in Belagavi

title: Court declines CBI plea for judicial custody of Shangloo in 1989 kidnapping case: lawyer
content: Mr. Shangloo was arrested in Srinagar on Dec. 1 on charges of involvement in the kidnapping of Rubaiyya Sayeed; his lawyer says no evidence was provided in the chargesheet against the accused

title: BJP-RSS are behind ‘One North East’ idea, says Meghalaya Congress chief
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma, Tipra Motha Party founder Pradyot Bikram Manikya Debbarma, and other leaders launched the regional front in November

title: Acquire land for Ejipura flyover without delay: GBA chief
content: Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) Chief Commissioner M. Maheshwar Rao pulled up officials over delay in land acquisition for the long delayed Ejipura flyover and directed them to expedite the same

title: Industries Minister Bharath invites Union Minister Rajnath Singh for launch of defence projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: He also call on Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari and urges him to introduce a ‘Passenger Bus Safety Act’ in view of the recent accidents

title: Minister seeks support for formation of Greater Tirupati Municipal Corporation
content: Anagani Satya Prasad assures to allocate funds in the upcoming budget for the construction of RDO offices in Sullurpet and Srikalahasti, as well as renovation of government offices

title: Andhra Pradesh unveils new rules to regulate urban display devices
content: The State-wide reform aims to streamline outdoor advertisements, enhance public safety, and improve municipal revenues across all urban local bodies

title: Only one in five candidates accepted PM Internship Scheme offers, and 20% of them quit early
content: Pilot project launched in October 2024 to provide 1.25 lakh internship opportunities; companies made 1.65 lakh offers over two rounds, but only 33,000 were accepted, of which 6,618 interns left prematurely

title: 48-hr hunger strike by loco pilots begins in Hubballi
content: Loco pilots and assistant loco pilots are participating in response to a call for a nation-wide stir

title: Waqf UMEED portal: Delays, technical glitches and a race against time
content: Documents of an estimated 20,000 unregistered waqf institutions, including smaller masjids and chillas, are to be uploaded to the portal

title: Man ends life after killing live-in partner in Bengaluru
content: A 51-year-old private firm employee allegedly strangled his live-in partner to death and later ended his life at their residence near Indira Priyadarshini Nagar, under the Rajagopalnagar police station limits

title: ‘Drug abuse cases go up in Shivamogga dist. in 2025 compared to last two years’
content: Superintendent of Police Mithun kumar attributes the increase in registration of cases due to proactive measures taken by the police

title: Fix lapses in implementation of Food Security Act, Kalaburagi officials told
content: After a three-day inspection tour, Karnataka State Food Commission directs the district administration to rectify all deficiencies

title: Road safety comes under scanner at Erumely after accidents involving pilgrims' vehicles
content: MVD, police launch joint efforts to check accidents.  Fifteen accidents on Erumely-Kanamala corridor since the start of this season

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: National weightlifting champion steps into a new arena
content: Chitra Chandramohan to contest as the LDF candidate in the Valarkavu division of the Thrissur Corporation

title: Tender for smart meters: Karnataka High Court quashes complaint of criminal wrong against Minister K.J. George and two officials
content: The complaint was lodged by BJP legislators C.N. Ashwath Narayan, S.R. Vishwanath, and Dheeraj Muniraj

title: Korean delegation donates ₹15.5-lakh surveillance equipment to Sathya Sai police
content: Equipment includes six Automatic Number Plate Recognition CCTV cameras, each valued at ₹58,000, a night-vision drone costing ₹7.5 lakh, and a day-vision drone worth ₹3.5 lakh

title: Head constable found dead in Shettihalli lake
content: A 50-year-old head constable attached to the Channapatna traffic station was found dead in Shettihalli lake in Channapatna Rural police station limits

title: 14 lakh MGNREGA workers drop off rolls in six weeks during e-KYC push in Andhra Pradesh, says report
content: However, A.P. has achieved the highest e-KYC completion rate in India, about 79% among all workers and 86% among active workers, suggests LibTech India report

title: Wildlife Bill: MPs urged to reject push for Presidential assent
content: Collective invokes legacy of Wildlife Protection Act, cautions against alleged attempts by both Central and State governments to dilute environmental safeguards

content: “If you don’t have the legal status to stay as a refugee in India, and you are an intruder, you know very well that we have a very, very sensitive border on the north India side,” says Chief Justice of India

title: India witnessing 'decolonisation of education’: Governor

title: Politics of social justice absent from electoral discourse: M.N. Karassery

content: He says Chinese presence in the Indian Ocean region should not come as a surprise to anyone, but what really is a matter of concern is the lack of transparency in their activities

title: More than 700 cough syrup manufacturers subjected to intense audit: Govt tells Rajya Sabha

title: Will there be baseball in 2027? Is a salary cap coming? What you need to know about MLB's looming labor battle﻿
content: the league's current labor agreement expires on Dec. 1, 2026 . there are major hurdles to clear and some key areas of disagreement . a lockout would shut down free agency and trades, as it did in 2021 .

title: How USC landed the No. 1 class and relaunched a recruiting powerhouse
content: a general manager was hired in 2024 by the head coach and athletic director of the Trojans . they interviewed a vast pool of candidates, rising personnel stars across the power 4 and NFL ranks . the search continued into the fall of 2024, dragging all the way through the program's 7-6 finish .

title: NFL odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers

ESPN's Jeff Borzello and Myron Medcalf preview six of the top games to watch over the next 48 hours below .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs

title: Drake Maye strengthens MVP case against Giants; Patriots win 10th straight
content: the new England Patriots beat the visiting new york Giants 33-15 on Monday night . Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 282 yards with two touchdowns and no interceptions . the Patriots won their 10th straight game to improve to an NFL-best 11-2 and enter their week 14 bye week .
